Listen to this episode on ART19
Courting Confirmation: Former Senator Doug Jones
Former Sen. Doug Jones, Democrat of Alabama, was the White House's pick to navigate Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson through the Senate confirmation process.
If you would like a signed "The Takeout" sticker, send a self-addressed, stamped envelope to: Takeout Sticker c/o CBS News, 2020 M St. NW, Washington DC 20036.
Plus, Jones weighs in on bleak prospects for Democrats on the ballot this November and says the president ought to do more to project a winning message.

Daniel Peebles
"The Takeout" is a weekly podcast about politics, policy and pop culture hosted by CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett.
Listeners can expect context and analysis of the week's political news in a casual format that allows for expanded conversation with a newsmaker.
"The Takeout" also airs on affiliates of the CBS News Radio network (check your local listings) and can also be found on Sirius XM's P.O.T.U.S.

McMaster on U.S. handling of Ukraine crisis
Episode 266 (Mar 11): Debating Aid to Ukraine: Rep. Mike Quigley (D-IL)
Episode 265 (Mar 4): E.U.

Ambassador to U.S. Stavros Lambrinidis discusses Ukraine
Episode 264 (Feb 25): The Attica Prison Rebellion: Filmmaker Stanley Nelson Jr.
Jones also offers an - actual - conspiracy theory on why Republicans attacked Judge Jackson for her child pornography sentencing record.
He sits down with Major to explain the strategy that led to the soon-to-be Justice Jackson to receive bipartisan support.
And you can email us your questions, comments, kudos and/or complaints: TakeoutPodcast@cbsnews.com.
Download, rate and subscribe here: iTunes, Spotify, Google Podcasts and Stitcher.
"The Takeout" also airs on CBSN every Friday and Saturday night at 9 p.m. ET/PT.
Each episode is recorded over a meal at a Washington, D.C., restaurant.
Producers: Arden Farhi, Jamie Benson, Sara Cook and Jake Rosen.
Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter: @takeoutpodcast.
You can also find "The Takeout" on Paramount+.
Channel (Channel 124) on Saturdays at 9 a.m.
